dfischer.utils

Class HttpTestURLThreadHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.HttpTestURLThreadHandler

  • public class HttpTestURLThreadHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Supports the parallel execution of several URL calls per simulated user.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HttpTestURLThreadHandler(int pageThreadStep, int maxParallelThreads, PerformanceData performanceData)
      Deprecated. 
      since V5.2-P
      HttpTestURLThreadHandler(int pageThreadStep, int maxParallelThreads, PerformanceData performanceData, HttpLoadTest loadTestInstance)
      Create a new execution queue used for parallel execution of several URL calls and measure the response time of a web page.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpTestURLThreadHandler

        public HttpTestURLThreadHandler(int pageThreadStep,
                        int maxParallelThreads,
                        PerformanceData performanceData)
        Deprecated. since V5.2-P
        Create a new execution queue used for parallel execution of several URL calls and measure the response time of a web page. Note: a new instance must be created for each measured web page.
        Parameters:
        pageThreadStep - thread step of web page
        maxParallelThreads - number of worker threads executing parallel URL calls - in addition to the main worker thread of the simulated user. The passed value must be equal or greater than one.
        performanceData - reference to the measurement result of the load test

      • HttpTestURLThreadHandler

        public HttpTestURLThreadHandler(int pageThreadStep,
                        int maxParallelThreads,
                        PerformanceData performanceData,
                        HttpLoadTest loadTestInstance)
        Create a new execution queue used for parallel execution of several URL calls and measure the response time of a web page. Note: a new instance must be created for each measured web page.
        Parameters:
        pageThreadStep - thread step of web page
        maxParallelThreads - number of worker threads executing parallel URL calls - in addition to the main worker thread of the simulated user. The passed value must be equal or greater than one.
        performanceData - reference to the measurement result of the load test
        loadTestInstance - reference to the running instance of the load test program (simulated user) that implements the SetThreadStepInterface
        Since:
        V5.2-P
        See Also:
        SetThreadStepInterface

    • Method Detail

      • insertInExecutionQueue

        public void insertInExecutionQueue(HttpTestURL httpTestURL,
                          int threadStep)
        Insert an URL in the execution queue in order to be asynchronously executed.
        Parameters:
        httpTestURL - URL to be added to the execution queue
        threadStep - thread step ot the URL

      • waitForSynch

        public void waitForSynch()
        Wait for the completion of all asynchronously executed URLs of this page.

      • getFirstThreadStep

        public int getFirstThreadStep()
        Get the thread step of the first asynchronously executed URL for this page. Note: the method waitForSynch() must be called in advance before calling this method.
        Returns:
        the thread step of the first asynchronously executed URL for this page, or -1 if no data are available

      • getNextThreadStep

        public int getNextThreadStep()
        Get the thread step of the next asynchronously executed URL for this page. Note: the method getFirstThreadStep() must be called in advance before calling this method.
        Returns:
        the thread step of the next asynchronously executed URL for this page, or -1 if no data are available

      • getLastThreadStep

        public int getLastThreadStep()
        Get the thread step of the last asynchronously executed URL for this page. Note: the method waitForSynch() must be called in advance before calling this method.
        Returns:
        the thread step of the last asynchronously executed URL for this page, or -1 if no data are available
        Since:
        V5.2-P

      • getHttpTestURL

        public HttpTestURL getHttpTestURL(int threadStep)
        Get the performance data of an asynchronously executed URL.
        Parameters:
        threadStep - thread step of the asynchronously executed URL
        Returns:
        the performance data of an asynchronously executed URL, or null if no data are available

      • addPageResponseTimeToResult

        public void addPageResponseTimeToResult(HttpLoadTest httpLoadTest)
        Add the measured response time of the page to the load test result. This must be done even so if all URLs have been executed in serial order (but also wehen some URLs have been executed in parallel)
        Note 1: this method should only be called if all URLs of the page have been executed AND when no fatal "red" URL errors are occurred within the page.
        Note 2: the method waitForSynch() must be called in advance before calling this method.
        Parameters:
        httpLoadTest - reference to the load test program

      • getPageThreadStep

        public int getPageThreadStep()
        Get the thread step of the page.
        Returns:
        the thread step of the page

      • getPageStartTime

        public long getPageStartTime()
        Get the timestamp when the measurement of the page was started.
        Returns:
        Timestamp in milliseconds (elapsed since January 1, 1970, GMT)

      • getPageSynchDoneTime

        public long getPageSynchDoneTime()
        Get the timestamp when all responses of all URLs of the page have been received (synchronized). Note: the method waitForSynch() must be called in advance before calling this method.
        Returns:
        Timestamp in milliseconds (elapsed since January 1, 1970, GMT)

      • getPageTime

        public long getPageTime()
        Get the measured response time of the page. Note: the method waitForSynch() must be called in advance before calling this method.
        Returns:
        the measured response time of the page in milliseconds, or -1 if no data are available
